title: Celtic's Old Firm hero Hatate: I can get even better
shortDescription: Reo Hatate agrees with Celtic manager Ange Postecoglu's assessment that there is much more to come from him following his Old Firm heroics in midweek.

title: Papers: PL clubs on alert after Real exit Haaland race
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Sunday's national newspapers...

title: Conte praises Kane's 'attitude and commitment'
shortDescription: Antonio Conte praised Harry Kane's "attitude and commitment" as the striker scored twice to help Tottenham beat Brighton 3-1 to reach the FA Cup fifth round.

title: Stunning Cameroon comeback sees hosts clinch AFCON third place
shortDescription: Hosts Cameroon produced a dramatic comeback from 3-0 down to beat Burkina Faso on penalties and secure third place in the Africa Cup of Nations.

title: Rooney: Pressures of playing career led to binge drinking
shortDescription: Wayne Rooney has opened up on a battle with binge drinking during his playing career and revealed a determination to prove himself a success in the dugout.

title: FA Cup fourth-round preview: Diaz in Liverpool squad?
shortDescription: Team news and how to follow on Sky Sports ahead of a bumper weekend of FA Cup fourth-round action.

title: Europe: Giroud double settles Milan derby
shortDescription: Olivier Giroud again showed why he can never be written off, scoring two late goals as AC Milan rallied to beat rivals Inter 2-1 and reignite Serie A title race.

title: Hodgson: Work to be done at Watford after Burnley stalemate
shortDescription: Burnley and Watford's long-awaited relegation showdown ended in a 0-0 draw, with Roy Hodgson picking up a point and clean sheet in his first game in charge.

title: FA Cup round-up: Luton reach fifth round for first time since 2013
shortDescription: Luton reached the fifth round of the FA Cup for the first time in nine years with a 3-0 win at Cambridge.

title: Ten-man Swansea hold on to beat Blackburn
shortDescription: Ten-man Swansea hold on to claim a surprise 1-0 win over automatic-promotion hopefuls Blackburn thanks to Michael Obafemi's first-half header.

title: Palace ease past Hartlepool | Lee 'forever grateful' for cancer support
shortDescription:
Crystal Palace eased into FA Cup fifth round after first-half goals from Marc
Guehi and Michael Olise downed Hartlepool at Selhurst Park.

title: Lampard: This is a day I'll never forget | Merson: Massive lift for Everton
shortDescription: Frank Lampard admits he had a day he will never forget after opening his Everton reign with a 4-1 FA Cup fourth-round victory over Premier League rivals Brentford.

title: Arrests after 'assault' on Accrington's Pell at Rotherham
shortDescription: Two Rotherham supporters have been arrested after an Accrington Stanley player was 'assaulted' during Saturday's League One game at New York Stadium.

title: Saints edge past Coventry but injuries worry Hasenhuttl
shortDescription: Southampton boss Ralph Hasenhuttl was left counting the cost of his side's extra-time FA Cup win over Coventry.

title: Dundee stay bottom after Ross County stage comeback
shortDescription: Dundee remain bottom of the Scottish Premiership after Ross County came from behind to secure a 2-1 victory at Dens Park.

title: Archer fires Preston to victory
shortDescription: Preston ended Hull's three-match winning run with a hard-fought 1-0 victory at the MKM Stadium.

title: Lampard makes winning start as Everton beat Brentford
shortDescription: New Everton manager Frank Lampard made the perfect start to life at Goodison Park with a 4-1 FA Cup victory over Brentford in his first game in charge.

title: Saints earn point against Dundee Utd despite Hallberg red
shortDescription: Dundee United edged into the top six after being forced to settle for a 0-0 Tayside derby draw with 10-man St Johnstone.

title: Obileye on target again as Livingston beat Aberdeen
shortDescription: Livingston earned a hard-fought win 2-1 win over Aberdeen thanks to goals from Ayo Obileye and Alan Forrest.

title: Ronan winner eases St Mirren woes at Hibs
shortDescription: Connor Ronan eased St Mirren's relegation worries and added to Hibernian's woes after scoring the only goal in a narrow 1-0 Premiership victory at Easter Road.
